Requisition ID

2105973674W

We are recruiting a Data Scientist who is passionate about crafting, developing, and implementing data architecture and engineering solutions that have a direct impact on J&J Deliver NA and End-to-End (E2E) business. Our function spans across the entire enterprise. This wide scope will enable the individual to work with various internal business units and external entities to help identify viable and data architecture opportunities and then conceive, develop, and implement data-focused data analytical solutions.

As part of our multifaceted Analytics Center of Excellence (COE), you'll be an individual contributor that takes ownership of tough business problems and builds creative solutions that support our E2E Supply Chain Deliver Organization. You'll push beyond current tools to deliver capabilities and solutions at the forefront of what is possible in the cloud building prototypes and scalable solutions.

The role will be instrumental in providing highly reliable, high-quality data & analytics solutions for our organization. You will define problems, identify data sources, then create the definition, design, and implementation of data science solutions. You will partner with regional data and analytics leads within both the Information Technology (IT) and Supply Chain organization to ensure delivery of North America (NA) Deliver analytics capabilities. You will help define and align with the data & analytics architecture across IT data & analytics groups in different sectors to improve opportunities as well as drive agile architecture to meet specific NA Deliver needs. We seek a creative problem solver who collaborates with business partners to bring forth new insights, challenge the status quo, and deliver innovation to enable our business through the effective use of technology.

Key Responsibilities

Create data science solutions that address measurable business problems within NA Deliver
Partner with IT teams to transition proof of concept IT work into a production-maintained environment
Deploy systematic solutions, including automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, machine learning, and other advanced analytics solutions
Ensure best practices are implemented in the areas of data science and machine learning
Conduct workshops and training sessions with other team members to introduce key data science concepts to change organizational behavior
Partner with Data Scientists and multi-functional teams to understand current processes; develop, pilot, and implement improvements incorporating results of data science use cases and POCs to deliver advanced analytics solutions
Work with cross-functional technology, analytics, and business team to convert use cases and POCs into technology-enabled minimally viable products (MVPs) and ultimately into scalable full-stack solutions, using Agile methodologies


Required

Qualifications

Undergrad in STEM or related field, e.g. statistics, operations research, computer science, mathematics required (Master’s preferred)
2 years of meaningful work experience in data analysis or related field (Data analyst or Scientist)
1 year in a role that creates a tangible business impact through analytics and data science
Solid understanding of data mining algorithms including machine learning techniques such as feature engineering, decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models
Proficiency in one or more statistical programming languages such as R, Python, or Scala
Experience with data modeling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured analytical solutions
Experience in applying real-time, modern machine learning analytics, artificial intelligence, and/or natural language processing-based methods throughout operational workflows
Proficiency in SQL and solid understanding of creation and extraction of data from relational databases
Ability to rapidly understand business requirements, communicate expectations to cross-functional development teams, document data findings that can be easily understood


Preferred

Previous experience building scalable cloud solutions (i.e. Azure, AWS, GCP)
Demonstrated familiarity with large data sets and understanding of data analysis workflows, as well as working across complex systems involving multiple data sets
Expertise in building scalable analytical solutions that can be automated
Proficiency in building complex machine learning solutions using neural networks and deep learning technologies
Demonstrated experience in creating business applications of MPP databases (i.e. AWS Redshift, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Google BigQuery)
Experience building solutions for file-based data architectures (i.e. Hadoop, DataBricks)
Previous experience with ETL and data migration technologies
Experience with testing suites and CI/CD integration for creating robust pipelines
Proficiency in deployment and monitoring of data science solutions into a production environment
Working knowledge of scalable data science and machine learning software (i.e. Spark and Databricks)
Experience with sharing results through data visualization tools and technologies (i.e. Power BI, Tableau, R, Python, etc.)

You will help define and align with the data & analytics architecture across IT data & analytics groups in different sectors to improve opportunities as well as drive agile architecture to meet specific NA Deliver needs. We seek a creative problem solver who collaborates with business partners to bring forth new insights, challenge the status quo, and deliver innovation to enable our business through the effective use of technology.

Key Responsibilities

Create data science solutions that address measurable business problems within NA Deliver
Partner with IT teams to transition proof of concept IT work into a production-maintained environment
Deploy systematic solutions, including automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, machine learning, and other advanced analytics solutions
Ensure best practices are implemented in the areas of data science and machine learning
Conduct workshops and training sessions with other team members to introduce key data science concepts to change organizational behavior
Partner with Data Scientists and multi-functional teams to understand current processes; develop, pilot, and implement improvements incorporating results of data science use cases and POCs to deliver advanced analytics solutions
Work with cross-functional technology, analytics, and business team to convert use cases and POCs into technology-enabled minimally viable products (MVPs) and ultimately into scalable full-stack solutions, using Agile methodologies


Required

Qualifications

Undergrad in STEM or related field, e.g. statistics, operations research, computer science, mathematics required (Master’s preferred)
2 years of meaningful work experience in data analysis or related field (Data analyst or Scientist)
1 year in a role that creates a tangible business impact through analytics and data science
Solid understanding of data mining algorithms including machine learning techniques such as feature engineering, decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models
Proficiency in one or more statistical programming languages such as R, Python, or Scala
Experience with data modeling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured analytical solutions
Experience in applying real-time, modern machine learning analytics, artificial intelligence, and/or natural language processing-based methods throughout operational workflows
Proficiency in SQL and solid understanding of creation and extraction of data from relational databases
Ability to rapidly understand business requirements, communicate expectations to cross-functional development teams, document data findings that can be easily understood


Preferred

Previous experience building scalable cloud solutions (i.e. Azure, AWS, GCP)
Demonstrated familiarity with large data sets and understanding of data analysis workflows, as well as working across complex systems involving multiple data sets
Expertise in building scalable analytical solutions that can be automated
Proficiency in building complex machine learning solutions using neural networks and deep learning technologies
Demonstrated experience in creating business applications of MPP databases (i.e. AWS Redshift, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Google BigQuery)
Experience building solutions for file-based data architectures (i.e. Hadoop, DataBricks)
Previous experience with ETL and data migration technologies
Experience with testing suites and CI/CD integration for creating robust pipelines
Proficiency in deployment and monitoring of data science solutions into a production environment
Working knowledge of scalable data science and machine learning software (i.e. Spark and Databricks)
Experience with sharing results through data visualization tools and technologies (i.e. Power BI, Tableau, R, Python, etc.)

Skillman, NJ flexible to other NJ sites

Requisition ID

2105973674W

We are recruiting a Data Scientist who is passionate about crafting, developing, and implementing data architecture and engineering solutions that have a direct impact on J&J Deliver NA and End-to-End (E2E) business. Our function spans across the entire enterprise. This wide scope will enable the individual to work with various internal business units and external entities to help identify viable and data architecture opportunities and then conceive, develop, and implement data-focused data analytical solutions.

As part of our multifaceted Analytics Center of Excellence (COE), you'll be an individual contributor that takes ownership of tough business problems and builds creative solutions that support our E2E Supply Chain Deliver Organization. You'll push beyond current tools to deliver capabilities and solutions at the forefront of what is possible in the cloud building prototypes and scalable solutions.

The role will be instrumental in providing highly reliable, high-quality data & analytics solutions for our organization. You will define problems, identify data sources, then create the definition, design, and implementation of data science solutions. You will partner with regional data and analytics leads within both the Information Technology (IT) and Supply Chain organization to ensure delivery of North America (NA) Deliver analytics capabilities. You will help define and align with the data & analytics architecture across IT data & analytics groups in different sectors to improve opportunities as well as drive agile architecture to meet specific NA Deliver needs. We seek a creative problem solver who collaborates with business partners to bring forth new insights, challenge the status quo, and deliver innovation to enable our business through the effective use of technology.

Key Responsibilities

Create data science solutions that address measurable business problems within NA Deliver
Partner with IT teams to transition proof of concept IT work into a production-maintained environment
Deploy systematic solutions, including automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, machine learning, and other advanced analytics solutions
Ensure best practices are implemented in the areas of data science and machine learning
Conduct workshops and training sessions with other team members to introduce key data science concepts to change organizational behavior
Partner with Data Scientists and multi-functional teams to understand current processes; develop, pilot, and implement improvements incorporating results of data science use cases and POCs to deliver advanced analytics solutions
Work with cross-functional technology, analytics, and business team to convert use cases and POCs into technology-enabled minimally viable products (MVPs) and ultimately into scalable full-stack solutions, using Agile methodologies


Required

Qualifications

Undergrad in STEM or related field, e.g. statistics, operations research, computer science, mathematics required (Master’s preferred)
2 years of meaningful work experience in data analysis or related field (Data analyst or Scientist)
1 year in a role that creates a tangible business impact through analytics and data science
Solid understanding of data mining algorithms including machine learning techniques such as feature engineering, decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models
Proficiency in one or more statistical programming languages such as R, Python, or Scala
Experience with data modeling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured analytical solutions
Experience in applying real-time, modern machine learning analytics, artificial intelligence, and/or natural language processing-based methods throughout operational workflows
Proficiency in SQL and solid understanding of creation and extraction of data from relational databases
Ability to rapidly understand business requirements, communicate expectations to cross-functional development teams, document data findings that can be easily understood


Preferred

Previous experience building scalable cloud solutions (i.e. Azure, AWS, GCP)
Demonstrated familiarity with large data sets and understanding of data analysis workflows, as well as working across complex systems involving multiple data sets
Expertise in building scalable analytical solutions that can be automated
Proficiency in building complex machine learning solutions using neural networks and deep learning technologies
Demonstrated experience in creating business applications of MPP databases (i.e. AWS Redshift, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Google BigQuery)
Experience building solutions for file-based data architectures (i.e. Hadoop, DataBricks)
Previous experience with ETL and data migration technologies
Experience with testing suites and CI/CD integration for creating robust pipelines
Proficiency in deployment and monitoring of data science solutions into a production environment
Working knowledge of scalable data science and machine learning software (i.e. Spark and Databricks)
Experience with sharing results through data visualization tools and technologies (i.e. Power BI, Tableau, R, Python, etc.)

Create data science solutions that address measurable business problems within NA Deliver
Partner with IT teams to transition proof of concept IT work into a production-maintained environment
Deploy systematic solutions, including automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, machine learning, and other advanced analytics solutions
Ensure best practices are implemented in the areas of data science and machine learning
Conduct workshops and training sessions with other team members to introduce key data science concepts to change organizational behavior
Partner with Data Scientists and multi-functional teams to understand current processes; develop, pilot, and implement improvements incorporating results of data science use cases and POCs to deliver advanced analytics solutions
Work with cross-functional technology, analytics, and business team to convert use cases and POCs into technology-enabled minimally viable products (MVPs) and ultimately into scalable full-stack solutions, using Agile methodologies


Required

Qualifications

Undergrad in STEM or related field, e.g. statistics, operations research, computer science, mathematics required (Master’s preferred)
2 years of meaningful work experience in data analysis or related field (Data analyst or Scientist)
1 year in a role that creates a tangible business impact through analytics and data science
Solid understanding of data mining algorithms including machine learning techniques such as feature engineering, decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models
Proficiency in one or more statistical programming languages such as R, Python, or Scala
Experience with data modeling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured analytical solutions
Experience in applying real-time, modern machine learning analytics, artificial intelligence, and/or natural language processing-based methods throughout operational workflows
Proficiency in SQL and solid understanding of creation and extraction of data from relational databases
Ability to rapidly understand business requirements, communicate expectations to cross-functional development teams, document data findings that can be easily understood


Preferred

Previous experience building scalable cloud solutions (i.e. Azure, AWS, GCP)
Demonstrated familiarity with large data sets and understanding of data analysis workflows, as well as working across complex systems involving multiple data sets
Expertise in building scalable analytical solutions that can be automated
Proficiency in building complex machine learning solutions using neural networks and deep learning technologies
Demonstrated experience in creating business applications of MPP databases (i.e. AWS Redshift, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Google BigQuery)
Experience building solutions for file-based data architectures (i.e. Hadoop, DataBricks)
Previous experience with ETL and data migration technologies
Experience with testing suites and CI/CD integration for creating robust pipelines
Proficiency in deployment and monitoring of data science solutions into a production environment
Working knowledge of scalable data science and machine learning software (i.e. Spark and Databricks)
Experience with sharing results through data visualization tools and technologies (i.e. Power BI, Tableau, R, Python, etc.)

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

The Promotion Enablement team is building tools to unlock the Creator community on Instagram. The team is responsible for building foundational infrastructure and uniquely tailored experiences that enable people to promote products on behalf of brands on our platform. Including helping creators discover products to recommend to their following, enabling people to share a product they bought after a purchase, and more! This team is also responsible for building destinations, experiences, and other mechanisms that help drive the discovery of products that people are promoting on behalf of brands on our platform.The team is responsible for helping brands engage with creators at scale to drive engagement and growth, and for providing creators with tools to showcase shopping products. We will capitalize on people’s desire to discover and learn about brands and products from the people who inspire them.We are looking for a candidate with strong product intuition and business acumen. You will help build not only the suite of tools that ensures creator success but also the mechanisms through which we incentivize and compensate creators. The ideal candidate is passionate about developing ecosystem level strategies and comfortable scoping roadmaps out of ambiguity. This role is highly cross functional and will require a strong communicator skilled at building relationships across the company. You will work with seller and consumer side shopping teams as well as the teams responsible for driving long term creator strategy and monetization.

Responsibilities
Help build the long term vision and strategy for creator and seller discovery on Instagram
Work independently to plan, lead, and implement (if needed) complex and timely analyses
Effectively communicate insights and recommendations to cross-functional partners and executives
Partner with product and engineering teams to identify the most impactful opportunities to improve and create experiences that grow shopping behavior in key segments
Define product success metrics, forecast metric changes, and set team/org goals
Lead projects across the company’s commerce and creator teams that drive understanding of the creator shopping ecosystem by partnering closely with engineering, data science, and research teams across the company
Support developing product roadmaps and coordinate analytics efforts across teams
Partner with product teams to structure mechanisms for effectively driving creator value

Minimum Qualification

Degree in an analytical or scientific field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research)
Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research) 5+ years of experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, SAS, MATLAB)
5+ years of experience doing complex quantitative analysis in product analytics
5+ years of experience communicating the results of analyses to leadership teams to influence the strategy
Experience leading complex analytics projects across multiple functions and stakeholders

Preferred Qualification
Background in e-Commerce, the Creator landscape, or other two-sided marketplaces
Experience communicating complex research in a clear, precise, and actionable manner

We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

This team is also responsible for building destinations, experiences, and other mechanisms that help drive the discovery of products that people are promoting on behalf of brands on our platform.The team is responsible for helping brands engage with creators at scale to drive engagement and growth, and for providing creators with tools to showcase shopping products. We will capitalize on people’s desire to discover and learn about brands and products from the people who inspire them.We are looking for a candidate with strong product intuition and business acumen. You will help build not only the suite of tools that ensures creator success but also the mechanisms through which we incentivize and compensate creators. The ideal candidate is passionate about developing ecosystem level strategies and comfortable scoping roadmaps out of ambiguity. This role is highly cross functional and will require a strong communicator skilled at building relationships across the company. You will work with seller and consumer side shopping teams as well as the teams responsible for driving long term creator strategy and monetization.

Responsibilities
Help build the long term vision and strategy for creator and seller discovery on Instagram
Work independently to plan, lead, and implement (if needed) complex and timely analyses
Effectively communicate insights and recommendations to cross-functional partners and executives
Partner with product and engineering teams to identify the most impactful opportunities to improve and create experiences that grow shopping behavior in key segments
Define product success metrics, forecast metric changes, and set team/org goals
Lead projects across the company’s commerce and creator teams that drive understanding of the creator shopping ecosystem by partnering closely with engineering, data science, and research teams across the company
Support developing product roadmaps and coordinate analytics efforts across teams
Partner with product teams to structure mechanisms for effectively driving creator value

Minimum Qualification

Degree in an analytical or scientific field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research)
Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research) 5+ years of experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, SAS, MATLAB)
5+ years of experience doing complex quantitative analysis in product analytics
5+ years of experience communicating the results of analyses to leadership teams to influence the strategy
Experience leading complex analytics projects across multiple functions and stakeholders

Preferred Qualification
Background in e-Commerce, the Creator landscape, or other two-sided marketplaces
Experience communicating complex research in a clear, precise, and actionable manner

Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

The Promotion Enablement team is building tools to unlock the Creator community on Instagram. The team is responsible for building foundational infrastructure and uniquely tailored experiences that enable people to promote products on behalf of brands on our platform. Including helping creators discover products to recommend to their following, enabling people to share a product they bought after a purchase, and more! This team is also responsible for building destinations, experiences, and other mechanisms that help drive the discovery of products that people are promoting on behalf of brands on our platform.The team is responsible for helping brands engage with creators at scale to drive engagement and growth, and for providing creators with tools to showcase shopping products. We will capitalize on people’s desire to discover and learn about brands and products from the people who inspire them.We are looking for a candidate with strong product intuition and business acumen. You will help build not only the suite of tools that ensures creator success but also the mechanisms through which we incentivize and compensate creators. The ideal candidate is passionate about developing ecosystem level strategies and comfortable scoping roadmaps out of ambiguity. This role is highly cross functional and will require a strong communicator skilled at building relationships across the company. You will work with seller and consumer side shopping teams as well as the teams responsible for driving long term creator strategy and monetization.

Responsibilities
Help build the long term vision and strategy for creator and seller discovery on Instagram
Work independently to plan, lead, and implement (if needed) complex and timely analyses
Effectively communicate insights and recommendations to cross-functional partners and executives
Partner with product and engineering teams to identify the most impactful opportunities to improve and create experiences that grow shopping behavior in key segments
Define product success metrics, forecast metric changes, and set team/org goals
Lead projects across the company’s commerce and creator teams that drive understanding of the creator shopping ecosystem by partnering closely with engineering, data science, and research teams across the company
Support developing product roadmaps and coordinate analytics efforts across teams
Partner with product teams to structure mechanisms for effectively driving creator value

Minimum Qualification

Degree in an analytical or scientific field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research)
Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research) 5+ years of experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, SAS, MATLAB)
5+ years of experience doing complex quantitative analysis in product analytics
5+ years of experience communicating the results of analyses to leadership teams to influence the strategy
Experience leading complex analytics projects across multiple functions and stakeholders

Preferred Qualification
Background in e-Commerce, the Creator landscape, or other two-sided marketplaces
Experience communicating complex research in a clear, precise, and actionable manner

We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Research & Insights, Deloitte Services LLP

We are looking for a teammate who will bring a blend of thoughtful, data driven curiosity and pragmatism. If you want to both design and deploy impactful, data-driven research to a global audience, then we want you on our team.

Data Science and Survey Advisory Services, Research & Insights Data Scientists play a key role developing research products that work to change perspectives on major business and government issues. Our Data Scientists are involved in all stages of the research process including working with internal clients to define research projects, research execution, presenting findings, and co-authoring public facing research reports. Strong candidates will be both thorough and creative in their research approaches, comfortable with public speaking, precise & concise writers, and able to both deliver and receive candid feedback.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Executes end-to-end research processes, working with internal clients to define research topics to conducting rigorous analysis. Ensures research utilizes appropriate methodologies (multivariate statistical modeling, text analytics, network analysis, time series analysis, econometrics, psychometrics, etc.)
Works collaboratively on a service-oriented team which supports numerous research requests covering multiple industry areas (e.g., consumer, energy, finance, government, media, technology, etc.)
Balances the demands of multiple long-term projects simultaneously
Presents on research findings to senior leadership both within and outside of Deloitte

Our Data Scientists play a key role in generating research into pivotal phenomena impacting US businesses and the US government. Our Data Scientists are required to occasionally travel (a few times a year at most) to attend offsite meetings, conferences, and/or training sessions.

Required Skills and Capabilities:

Experience with Python and/or R
Prior experience that has involved extensive use of at least two of the methodologies below:
Econometrics/Statistical Modeling (Linear Regression, Time Series Analysis, etc.)
Interactive Visuals (Power BI, MarketSight, Tableau, Qlik, etc.)
Machine Learning (Random Forests, Clustering, etc.)
Text Analytics (Topic Modeling, Natural Language Processing, Sentiment Analysis, etc.)
Network Analysis (Particularly Social)
Neural Networks (Artificial, Convolutional, or Recurrent)
Geostatistics/Spatial Modeling (Geographic information Systems, Spatial Regression, etc.)
Bachelors degree in Data Science, Statistics, Quantitative Behavioral Science other highly quantitative field
Travel up to 10% (While 10% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.

Desired Skills and Capabilities:

Masters or PhD in Data Science, Statistics, Quantitative Behavioral Science or other highly quantitative field
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision as well as in a collaborative team environment
Prior publication of work (please provide links if possible)
Experience managing data-driven research, from project ideation to deployment
Deep expertise in Python or R
Working knowledge of SQL (Structured Query Language)
Familiarity with data visualization software, such as MarketSight, Power BI, Tableau, etc.

Data Science and Survey Advisory Services, Research & Insights Data Scientists play a key role developing research products that work to change perspectives on major business and government issues. Duties and Responsibilities:

Executes end-to-end research processes, working with internal clients to define research topics to conducting rigorous analysis. Ensures research utilizes appropriate methodologies (multivariate statistical modeling, text analytics, network analysis, time series analysis, econometrics, psychometrics, etc.)
Works collaboratively on a service-oriented team which supports numerous research requests covering multiple industry areas (e.g., consumer, energy, finance, government, media, technology, etc.)
Balances the demands of multiple long-term projects simultaneously
Presents on research findings to senior leadership both within and outside of Deloitte

Our Data Scientists play a key role in generating research into pivotal phenomena impacting US businesses and the US government. Our Data Scientists are required to occasionally travel (a few times a year at most) to attend offsite meetings, conferences, and/or training sessions.

Experience with Python and/or R
Prior experience that has involved extensive use of at least two of the methodologies below:

GALE is a creative media consultancy that brings business insights to brand storytelling and activates it across every channel. With expertise in business strategy, media, CRM, addressable and integrated brand communications, performance marketing, and technology, GALE creates marketing systems and communications that grow businesses. GALE delivers strong outcomes for its partners in automotive, QSR, retail, gaming, entertainment, telecom and more. Founded in 2014, the agency currently has offices in New York, Detroit, Singapore, Toronto, Austin, Los Angeles, London, and Bengaluru.

 

Some Brands We Work With: Chipotle, Seagate, T-Mobile, NBA, MGM, Allstate, Resorts World Genting, BMO, and Santander.

 

If you’re driven by a passion to build something great, a desire to innovate, and a commitment to achieve excellence in your craft, GALE is a great place for you.

 

Inclusion in Hiring

GALE is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. Please consider applying for this role even if you do not meet 100% of the suggested requirements, and/or if you have gaps in your resume. 




About the role

We're currently seeking Data Scientists to join our rapidly growing Data Science and Analytics (DSA) team - ones that have a passion for working with real world data to derive actionable insights. Successful candidates for the role will work with clients and internal stakeholders to define, prototype, and produce custom solutions using state-of-the-art big data platforms, analytics, and machine learning.

 

The ideal candidate will have a background in a quantitative field and have experience with large datasets, the Hadoop ecosystem, statistics/analysis, and client-facing activities. They will be enthusiastic, creative, results focused. You will have the opportunity to work across varying sets of data with a variety of clients.

 

Who you are

● High fluency with SQL on one or more of the following databases - Hive,PostgreSQL,Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL

● Fluency with scripting (Python, Bash, etc.)

● Experience with statistical programming languages/packages (R, SAS, Scipy/Numpy/Scikitlearn)

● Familiar with Unix/Linux systems and command-line interfaces and editors

● Familiar with the AWS ecosystem

● Comfortable working with the Hadoop ecosystem (Spark, MapReduce, Hive, YARN)

● Experience with supervised learning algorithms and their application to large data sets

● Experience loading, cleansing, and analyzing very large datasets

 

Nice to haves

● Experience with unsupervised clustering algorithms, especially on large data sets

● Some experience with interactive visualization of data in Shiney, D3 or Dash

● Specific experience with the following programming languages: Scala, Apache Spark, Python, R

● Some applied experience with ANN frameworks like: Tensorflow, Keras, Torch, Mxnet, etc.

 

What you will be doing

● Define, build, and present models to C-suite executives in industries ranging from automotive to startup

● Ingest, manipulate and model large datasets using supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques to help define the structure of the customer base

● Produce prototypes, POCs, or APIs to showcase and make available models and their outcomes




Inclusion in the Workplace

We believe in inclusivity and do our best work when people with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and skills are brought together. Our Core Values are at the root of GALE’s collaborative environment and help to foster a strong community. 

Our Code of Conduct, Human Resources policies and executive investment in inclusion further support and protect GALE’s inclusive workplace. 

 

Our Hiring Process

We want you to be just as discerning in making your next career move as we are finding great talent to join our team. Our interview process generally consists of the following stages to allow you to meet a range of people from various disciplines and domains. You will be assessed at each stage before being invited to move to the next. 

· Phone screen with a member of our Talent Acquisition Team

· Interview with the Hiring Manager, who will generally be your manager. 

· Where relevant for the role, a technical aptitude test. (i.e. for domains in technology, data science, etc.,…)

· Interview with a member of our team from a different Department than yours. 

· Interview with a member of our Leadership Team. 

 

Please discuss with our recruiters if you require any accommodations throughout the process to help enable a smooth interview (i.e. accessibility in terms of location, timing, method, etc.,...).

We want you to be just as discerning in making your next career move as we are finding great talent to join our team. Our interview process generally consists of the following stages to allow you to meet a range of people from various disciplines and domains. You will be assessed at each stage before being invited to move to the next. 

· Phone screen with a member of our Talent Acquisition Team

· Interview with the Hiring Manager, who will generally be your manager. 

· Where relevant for the role, a technical aptitude test. (i.e. for domains in technology, data science, etc.,…)

· Interview with a member of our team from a different Department than yours. 

· Interview with a member of our Leadership Team. 

 

Please discuss with our recruiters if you require any accommodations throughout the process to help enable a smooth interview (i.e. accessibility in terms of location, timing, method, etc.,...).

GALE is a creative media consultancy that brings business insights to brand storytelling and activates it across every channel. With expertise in business strategy, media, CRM, addressable and integrated brand communications, performance marketing, and technology, GALE creates marketing systems and communications that grow businesses. GALE delivers strong outcomes for its partners in automotive, QSR, retail, gaming, entertainment, telecom and more. Founded in 2014, the agency currently has offices in New York, Detroit, Singapore, Toronto, Austin, Los Angeles, London, and Bengaluru.

 

Some Brands We Work With: Chipotle, Seagate, T-Mobile, NBA, MGM, Allstate, Resorts World Genting, BMO, and Santander.

 

If you’re driven by a passion to build something great, a desire to innovate, and a commitment to achieve excellence in your craft, GALE is a great place for you.

 

Inclusion in Hiring

GALE is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. Please consider applying for this role even if you do not meet 100% of the suggested requirements, and/or if you have gaps in your resume. 




About the role

We're currently seeking Data Scientists to join our rapidly growing Data Science and Analytics (DSA) team - ones that have a passion for working with real world data to derive actionable insights. Successful candidates for the role will work with clients and internal stakeholders to define, prototype, and produce custom solutions using state-of-the-art big data platforms, analytics, and machine learning.

 

The ideal candidate will have a background in a quantitative field and have experience with large datasets, the Hadoop ecosystem, statistics/analysis, and client-facing activities. They will be enthusiastic, creative, results focused. You will have the opportunity to work across varying sets of data with a variety of clients.

 

Who you are

● High fluency with SQL on one or more of the following databases - Hive,PostgreSQL,Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL

● Fluency with scripting (Python, Bash, etc.)

● Experience with statistical programming languages/packages (R, SAS, Scipy/Numpy/Scikitlearn)

● Familiar with Unix/Linux systems and command-line interfaces and editors

● Familiar with the AWS ecosystem

● Comfortable working with the Hadoop ecosystem (Spark, MapReduce, Hive, YARN)

● Experience with supervised learning algorithms and their application to large data sets

● Experience loading, cleansing, and analyzing very large datasets

 

Nice to haves

● Experience with unsupervised clustering algorithms, especially on large data sets

● Some experience with interactive visualization of data in Shiney, D3 or Dash

● Specific experience with the following programming languages: Scala, Apache Spark, Python, R

● Some applied experience with ANN frameworks like: Tensorflow, Keras, Torch, Mxnet, etc.

 

What you will be doing

● Define, build, and present models to C-suite executives in industries ranging from automotive to startup

● Ingest, manipulate and model large datasets using supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques to help define the structure of the customer base

● Produce prototypes, POCs, or APIs to showcase and make available models and their outcomes




Inclusion in the Workplace

We believe in inclusivity and do our best work when people with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and skills are brought together. Our Core Values are at the root of GALE’s collaborative environment and help to foster a strong community. 

Our Code of Conduct, Human Resources policies and executive investment in inclusion further support and protect GALE’s inclusive workplace. 

 

Our Hiring Process

We want you to be just as discerning in making your next career move as we are finding great talent to join our team. Our interview process generally consists of the following stages to allow you to meet a range of people from various disciplines and domains. You will be assessed at each stage before being invited to move to the next. 

· Phone screen with a member of our Talent Acquisition Team

· Interview with the Hiring Manager, who will generally be your manager. 

· Where relevant for the role, a technical aptitude test. (i.e. for domains in technology, data science, etc.,…)

· Interview with a member of our team from a different Department than yours. 

· Interview with a member of our Leadership Team. 

 

Please discuss with our recruiters if you require any accommodations throughout the process to help enable a smooth interview (i.e. accessibility in terms of location, timing, method, etc.,...).

● Comfortable working with the Hadoop ecosystem (Spark, MapReduce, Hive, YARN)

● Experience with supervised learning algorithms and their application to large data sets

Founded in 2014, the agency currently has offices in New York, Detroit, Singapore, Toronto, Austin, Los Angeles, London, and Bengaluru.

 

Some Brands We Work With: Chipotle, Seagate, T-Mobile, NBA, MGM, Allstate, Resorts World Genting, BMO, and Santander.

 

If you’re driven by a passion to build something great, a desire to innovate, and a commitment to achieve excellence in your craft, GALE is a great place for you.

 

Inclusion in Hiring

GALE is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. Please consider applying for this role even if you do not meet 100% of the suggested requirements, and/or if you have gaps in your resume. 




About the role

We're currently seeking Data Scientists to join our rapidly growing Data Science and Analytics (DSA) team - ones that have a passion for working with real world data to derive actionable insights. Successful candidates for the role will work with clients and internal stakeholders to define, prototype, and produce custom solutions using state-of-the-art big data platforms, analytics, and machine learning.

 

The ideal candidate will have a background in a quantitative field and have experience with large datasets, the Hadoop ecosystem, statistics/analysis, and client-facing activities. They will be enthusiastic, creative, results focused. You will have the opportunity to work across varying sets of data with a variety of clients.

 

Who you are

● High fluency with SQL on one or more of the following databases - Hive,PostgreSQL,Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL

● Fluency with scripting (Python, Bash, etc.)

● Experience with statistical programming languages/packages (R, SAS, Scipy/Numpy/Scikitlearn)

● Familiar with Unix/Linux systems and command-line interfaces and editors

● Familiar with the AWS ecosystem

● Comfortable working with the Hadoop ecosystem (Spark, MapReduce, Hive, YARN)

● Experience with supervised learning algorithms and their application to large data sets

● Experience loading, cleansing, and analyzing very large datasets

 

Nice to haves

● Experience with unsupervised clustering algorithms, especially on large data sets

● Some experience with interactive visualization of data in Shiney, D3 or Dash

● Specific experience with the following programming languages: Scala, Apache Spark, Python, R

● Some applied experience with ANN frameworks like: Tensorflow, Keras, Torch, Mxnet, etc.

 

What you will be doing

● Define, build, and present models to C-suite executives in industries ranging from automotive to startup

● Ingest, manipulate and model large datasets using supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques to help define the structure of the customer base

● Produce prototypes, POCs, or APIs to showcase and make available models and their outcomes




Inclusion in the Workplace

We believe in inclusivity and do our best work when people with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and skills are brought together. Our Core Values are at the root of GALE’s collaborative environment and help to foster a strong community. 

Our Code of Conduct, Human Resources policies and executive investment in inclusion further support and protect GALE’s inclusive workplace. 

 

Our Hiring Process

We want you to be just as discerning in making your next career move as we are finding great talent to join our team. Our interview process generally consists of the following stages to allow you to meet a range of people from various disciplines and domains. You will be assessed at each stage before being invited to move to the next. 

· Phone screen with a member of our Talent Acquisition Team

· Interview with the Hiring Manager, who will generally be your manager. 

· Where relevant for the role, a technical aptitude test. (i.e. for domains in technology, data science, etc.,…)

· Interview with a member of our team from a different Department than yours. 

· Interview with a member of our Leadership Team. 

 

Please discuss with our recruiters if you require any accommodations throughout the process to help enable a smooth interview (i.e. accessibility in terms of location, timing, method, etc.,...).

GALE is a creative media consultancy that brings business insights to brand storytelling and activates it across every channel. With expertise in business strategy, media, CRM, addressable and integrated brand communications, performance marketing, and technology, GALE creates marketing systems and communications that grow businesses. GALE delivers strong outcomes for its partners in automotive, QSR, retail, gaming, entertainment, telecom and more. Founded in 2014, the agency currently has offices in New York, Detroit, Singapore, Toronto, Austin, Los Angeles, London, and Bengaluru.

 

Some Brands We Work With: Chipotle, Seagate, T-Mobile, NBA, MGM, Allstate, Resorts World Genting, BMO, and Santander.

 

If you’re driven by a passion to build something great, a desire to innovate, and a commitment to achieve excellence in your craft, GALE is a great place for you.

 

Inclusion in Hiring

GALE is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. Please consider applying for this role even if you do not meet 100% of the suggested requirements, and/or if you have gaps in your resume. 




About the role

We're currently seeking Data Scientists to join our rapidly growing Data Science and Analytics (DSA) team - ones that have a passion for working with real world data to derive actionable insights. Successful candidates for the role will work with clients and internal stakeholders to define, prototype, and produce custom solutions using state-of-the-art big data platforms, analytics, and machine learning.

 

The ideal candidate will have a background in a quantitative field and have experience with large datasets, the Hadoop ecosystem, statistics/analysis, and client-facing activities. They will be enthusiastic, creative, results focused. You will have the opportunity to work across varying sets of data with a variety of clients.

 

Who you are

● High fluency with SQL on one or more of the following databases - Hive,PostgreSQL,Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL

● Fluency with scripting (Python, Bash, etc.)

● Experience with statistical programming languages/packages (R, SAS, Scipy/Numpy/Scikitlearn)

● Familiar with Unix/Linux systems and command-line interfaces and editors

● Familiar with the AWS ecosystem

● Comfortable working with the Hadoop ecosystem (Spark, MapReduce, Hive, YARN)

● Experience with supervised learning algorithms and their application to large data sets

● Experience loading, cleansing, and analyzing very large datasets

 

Nice to haves

● Experience with unsupervised clustering algorithms, especially on large data sets

● Some experience with interactive visualization of data in Shiney, D3 or Dash

● Specific experience with the following programming languages: Scala, Apache Spark, Python, R

● Some applied experience with ANN frameworks like: Tensorflow, Keras, Torch, Mxnet, etc.

 

What you will be doing

● Define, build, and present models to C-suite executives in industries ranging from automotive to startup

● Ingest, manipulate and model large datasets using supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques to help define the structure of the customer base

● Produce prototypes, POCs, or APIs to showcase and make available models and their outcomes

About the role

We're currently seeking Data Scientists to join our rapidly growing Data Science and Analytics (DSA) team - ones that have a passion for working with real world data to derive actionable insights. Successful candidates for the role will work with clients and internal stakeholders to define, prototype, and produce custom solutions using state-of-the-art big data platforms, analytics, and machine learning.

 

The ideal candidate will have a background in a quantitative field and have experience with large datasets, the Hadoop ecosystem, statistics/analysis, and client-facing activities. They will be enthusiastic, creative, results focused. You will have the opportunity to work across varying sets of data with a variety of clients.

 

Who you are

● High fluency with SQL on one or more of the following databases - Hive,PostgreSQL,Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL

● Fluency with scripting (Python, Bash, etc.)

● Experience with statistical programming languages/packages (R, SAS, Scipy/Numpy/Scikitlearn)

● Familiar with Unix/Linux systems and command-line interfaces and editors

● Familiar with the AWS ecosystem

● Comfortable working with the Hadoop ecosystem (Spark, MapReduce, Hive, YARN)

● Experience with supervised learning algorithms and their application to large data sets

● Experience loading, cleansing, and analyzing very large datasets

 

Nice to haves

● Experience with unsupervised clustering algorithms, especially on large data sets

● Some experience with interactive visualization of data in Shiney, D3 or Dash

● Specific experience with the following programming languages: Scala, Apache Spark, Python, R

● Some applied experience with ANN frameworks like: Tensorflow, Keras, Torch, Mxnet, etc.

 

What you will be doing

● Define, build, and present models to C-suite executives in industries ranging from automotive to startup

● Ingest, manipulate and model large datasets using supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques to help define the structure of the customer base

● Produce prototypes, POCs, or APIs to showcase and make available models and their outcomes




Inclusion in the Workplace

We believe in inclusivity and do our best work when people with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and skills are brought together. Our Core Values are at the root of GALE’s collaborative environment and help to foster a strong community. 

Our Code of Conduct, Human Resources policies and executive investment in inclusion further support and protect GALE’s inclusive workplace. 

 

Our Hiring Process

We want you to be just as discerning in making your next career move as we are finding great talent to join our team. Our interview process generally consists of the following stages to allow you to meet a range of people from various disciplines and domains. You will be assessed at each stage before being invited to move to the next. 

· Phone screen with a member of our Talent Acquisition Team

· Interview with the Hiring Manager, who will generally be your manager. 

· Where relevant for the role, a technical aptitude test. (i.e. for domains in technology, data science, etc.,…)

· Interview with a member of our team from a different Department than yours. 

· Interview with a member of our Leadership Team. 

 

Please discuss with our recruiters if you require any accommodations throughout the process to help enable a smooth interview (i.e. accessibility in terms of location, timing, method, etc.,...).

GALE is a creative media consultancy that brings business insights to brand storytelling and activates it across every channel. With expertise in business strategy, media, CRM, addressable and integrated brand communications, performance marketing, and technology, GALE creates marketing systems and communications that grow businesses. GALE delivers strong outcomes for its partners in automotive, QSR, retail, gaming, entertainment, telecom and more. Founded in 2014, the agency currently has offices in New York, Detroit, Singapore, Toronto, Austin, Los Angeles, London, and Bengaluru.

 

Some Brands We Work With: Chipotle, Seagate, T-Mobile, NBA, MGM, Allstate, Resorts World Genting, BMO, and Santander.

 

If you’re driven by a passion to build something great, a desire to innovate, and a commitment to achieve excellence in your craft, GALE is a great place for you.

 

Inclusion in Hiring

GALE is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. Please consider applying for this role even if you do not meet 100% of the suggested requirements, and/or if you have gaps in your resume.
